wrote to himself when Paul Bremer 's appointment was announced in May 2003, quietly criticizing President Bush for having had lunch alone with the new envoy. "Shouldn't have done so," the memo said. Tommy Sheridan asked him about a House of Commons committee report which stated that the NoW "turned a blind eye" and "at worst actively condoned" bugging and hacking in the newsroom. Andy Coulson replied: I don't accept there was a culture of phone hacking at the NoW. There was a very unfortunate, to put it mildly, case involving Clive Goodman . No one was more sorry about it than me; that's why I resigned. Tommy Sheridan asked whether he know what the phrase "the dark arts" meant. NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell presented the Pete Roselle trophy to him this morning. After accepting it, Aaron Rodgers talked about the journey that led him to the Super Bowl and a Championship win. Finally getting an opportunity and making the most of it, and this was another opportunity last night, they don't come around that often, i just wanted to make the most of it, we did as a team, a great team win, a great group of guys in the locker room, just really excited to be a part of it, said Aaron Rodgers .
